summary: The diff successfully implements all GitHub Pages deployment requirements. A .nojekyll file was added to the deployment output, hash-based routing was configured in App.tsx for GitHub Pages compatibility, and all requirements appear to be addressed based on the evidence in the diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure the build output directory structure is compatible with GitHub Pages by placing index.html and all compiled assets at the root level of the deployment branch
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows no changes to build configuration files (vite.config.ts, package.json build scripts) or deployment directory structure setup. While the .nojekyll file was added to frontend/public/ (which typically gets copied to build output), there is no evidence of configuring where the build output goes or ensuring index.html is at the root of the deployment directory.

missing_requirements.requirement: Configure base URL in the frontend build configuration to match the GitHub Pages deployment path if the site is deployed to a project subdirectory rather than a custom domain
missing_requirements.reason: No build configuration changes (vite.config.ts base URL setting) are shown in the diff. While hash-based routing was implemented, there is no evidence of base URL configuration for asset resolution in project subdirectory deployments.
